intro: Bomarea simplex, commonly known as the simple bomarea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a tuberous root system that aids in its survival in tropical environments. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it thrives in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
